title: An Open Land: Photographs of the Midwest,1852-1982
description:
This exhibition provided the first-ever survey of landscape photography of the Midwest. It aimed to generate an appreciation of the beauty and need for preservation of
Midwest landscapes. With over one hundred photographs displayed, this exhibition featured photographers such as Tom Arndt, Jay Boersma, Andrew Dahl, Michael Johnson, and Art Sinsabaugh. 
In addition to the Art Institute of Chicago, photographs and prints from negatives in collections at the Minnesota Historical Society, the Missouri Historical Society, the State Historical Society of Iowa, the State Historical Society of Wisconsin, among others were displayed.

input: An Open Land: Photographs of the Midwest,1852-1982
